summary:
Darker Nights, Caves without the Bright days, bring your torches \'cause you will need them! 
No FPS drops at all.
descriptionHtml:
[color=Yellow]Favorable FXAA Injector Settings[/color]


[color=Cyan][size=2]I appreciate all the feedback I get, please leave a comment so I know what you think & If you like what you see please endorse to show your appreciation, thankyou.[/size][/color]

[color=Yellow][size=3]What is this?[/size][/color]
What I\'ve done is created my own version of the FXAA Injector settings that better suit my game play, I wanted darker nights where you can still see but would be advised to use a torch, but I didn\'t want those bright days that usually go along with dark nights I wanted it to look cold & miserable. I feel that with this the lights look warmer & more usefull. I understand that this isn\'t for everybody but that odd few who like the same type of colours in their games as me, I hope you enjoy it.

If you find it too dark, open up the FXAA_Tool & then change the Gamma to your liking.

In creating this I had FPS in mind, I\'ve had literally no FPS drops what so ever. please tell me if your results differ. 

This [color=Red]won\'t[/color] work with FXAA [color=Red]1.3[/color] only [color=Green]2.1[/color]

[color=Yellow][size=2]Installation[/size][/color]
Drop the contents into your Skyrim directory NOT your data folder.


[color=Red][size=2]INCOMPATABILITIES[/size][/color]
If you use any other FXAA settings with mine then it\'s doubtfull it would work.

[color=Red]NOTICE - If you\'ve already got a [/color] [color=Yellow]injFX_Shaders[/color][color=Red] folder in your directory delete it, as if merged with my mod the results could differ & cause instabilities.[/color]
author: WezEllison
